In a nutshell, Figure 4.9 shows how a given type of Classiﬁcation Scheme can be modeled following one or
more data models, each of which could be implemented in different ways at the implementation layer. As
an example, Figure 4.9 shows a classiﬁcation scheme modeled following a path enumeration model. In this
case, the classiﬁcation scheme is implemented in a database and in an XML ﬁle.

Patterns for Re-engineering Classiﬁcation Schemes into Ontologies
In this section we present the re-engineering patterns (PR-NOR) for re-engineering classiﬁcation schemes
into ontologies. These patterns come from the experience of ontology engineers in developing ontologies
using classiﬁcation schemes in several projects (SEEMP3, NeOn4, and Knowledge Web5). The patterns are:
